availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Tingnal J. Hopkins (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer and bookkeeper.)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer and bookkeeper. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy D. Hamilton Hopkins in Henderson County, Kentucky, on August 2, 1832. Father of William Hopkins, Ann M. Hopkins, Lucy H. Hopkins, Philip T. Hopkins, Eliza T. Hopkins, and Martha C. Hopkins. Farmer in Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Household included one additional enslaved person in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p.356A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 6.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 153B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film 000576460.
